Package networking.frontend

Class NetworkDataObject

java.lang.Object
networking.frontend.NetworkDataObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class NetworkDataObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
A piece of data sent over the network between clients and servers.
Author:
john_shelby
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.lang.String CLIENT_LIST
    Sent by the server whenever clients connect or disconnect.
    java.net.InetAddress dataSource
    The IP address of the client or server that originated this data object (as viewed by the server).
    static java.lang.String DISCONNECT
    Sent by the server whenever a client disconnects (or the server itself disconnects).

    Used by clients attempting to connect to the server.
    java.lang.Object[] message
    Additional data.
    static java.lang.String MESSAGE
    Used by client programs to send program data.
    java.lang.String messageType
    The type of message being sent in this data object.

  • Field Details

    • HANDSHAKE

      public static final java.lang.String HANDSHAKE
      Used by clients attempting to connect to the server. The receipt of a HANDSHAKE indicates that new client has connected. Message array should be length 1, containing only the programID (type String).
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • CLIENT_LIST

      public static final java.lang.String CLIENT_LIST
      Sent by the server whenever clients connect or disconnect. Message array should be length == number of connected clients, containing the IP of each connected client (type InetAddress).
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DISCONNECT

      public static final java.lang.String DISCONNECT
      Sent by the server whenever a client disconnects (or the server itself disconnects). Message array should be length 0.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • MESSAGE

      public static final java.lang.String MESSAGE
      Used by client programs to send program data. Ignored by the server. Message array can be whatever is desired by client programs.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • serverHost

      public java.net.InetAddress serverHost
      The IP address of the connected server.

    • dataSource

      public java.net.InetAddress dataSource
      The IP address of the client or server that originated this data object (as viewed by the server).

    • messageType

      public java.lang.String messageType
      The type of message being sent in this data object. Possible values include HANDSHAKE, CLIENT_LIST, DISCONNECT, or MESSAGE.

    • message

      public java.lang.Object[] message
      Additional data. The length of this array, and the types of data it contains, depends on the messageType and the messages sent by connected clients.

  • Constructor Details

    • NetworkDataObject

      public NetworkDataObject()

  • Method Details

    • getSourceIP

      public java.lang.String getSourceIP()
      Returns:
      The IP address of the dataSource, as a String.

    • getSourceName

      public java.lang.String getSourceName()
      Returns:
      The name of the dataSource.
